thread.title: Shark attack off Hinchinbrook Island leaves man with critical injuries - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
thread.title_full: Shark attack off Hinchinbrook Island leaves man with critical injuries - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)

author: Casey Briggs
title: Shark attack off Hinchinbrook Island leaves man with critical injuries - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
By Casey Briggs and staff Updated February 18, 2017 15:38:41 Map: Cardwell 4849 
The friends of a man who was bitten multiple times on the leg by a shark in waters off far north Queensland saved his life with their rapid first aid response, paramedics say. 
Cairns resident Glenn Dickson was spearfishing with three friends off Hinchinbrook Island, which lies east of Cardwell, when he was attacked about 10:30am. Photo: Glenn Dickson was spearfishing when he was bitten on the leg. (Facebook: Glenn Dickson) 
Queensland Ambulance Service spokesman Martin Taylor said the 26-year-old suffered severe blood loss with multiple bites to his upper and lower leg. 
"The friends have immediately pulled him out of the water and applied emergency first aid," Mr Taylor said. 
"They put a tourniquet up high and tight on his femur and stopped the subsequent bleeding which was quite significant. 
"The initial actions by the three friends have definitely saved this gentleman's life." 
Mr Dickson was brought to shore by a boat and treated by paramedics on a jetty before a rescue helicopter arrived to fly him to Cairns Hospital. 
He has gone into surgery in a stable but critical condition. 
Paramedics believe he was bitten by either a bull shark or a tiger shark.
